basics.name: Bianca Wiesmayr
basics.summary: Bianca Wiesmayr is a postdoctoral researcher at the LIT Cyber-Physical Systems Lab at Johannes Kepler University Linz, where she is responsible for the research area in model-driven control software engineering. She has completed her doctorate in technical sciences in 2023 (subject computer science) at the same university. She researches model-driven methods for developing automation systems. Her dissertation investigated the use of behavior models for the implementation and maintenance of control software in the domain-specific modeling language defined in IEC 61499. In addition to her research, she is an active software developer and project team member for the open-source development environment Eclipse 4diac, which provides an infrastructure for engineering Industry 4.0 and IIoT systems and is used in industry and academia.
